title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 646-7.10 - Illumination of permitted signs
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 646-7.10 - Illumination of permitted signs

State Regulations

Only white artificial lighting shall be used to
illuminate a sign. No flashing, intermittent or moving light or lights, or neon
lamps, shall constitute a part of or be used to illuminate a sign. No light
shall be placed in such a manner that it is a hazard to the travelling public, or shall cause any objectionable glare, either direct or
reflected. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
646-7.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
